description: Borrowed from Latin concatenātiō. Related to chain.

entries.meaning: (countable) A series of links united; a series or order of things depending on each other, as if linked together; a chain, a succession.
examples: Try and penetrate with our limited means of the secrets of nature and you will find that, behind all the discernible concatenations, there remains something subtle, intangible and inexplicable.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The application of these series of links.
(programming) The operation of joining multiple character strings.
(programming) A character string formed by joining multiple character strings.
